body:
So there's good news and bad news.

:thumbsup: The good news is that everyone that needs to sign a CLA (the pull request submitter and all commit authors) have done so.  Everything is all good there.

:confused: The bad news is that it appears that one or more commits were authored by someone other than the pull request submitter.  We need to confirm that they're okay with their commits being contributed to this project.  Please have them confirm that here in the pull request.

*Note to project maintainer: This is a terminal state, meaning the `cla/google` commit status will not change from this state. It's up to you to confirm consent of the commit author(s) and merge this pull request when appropriate.*

<!-- need_author_consent -->

Ran the microbenchmarks on my corp desktop:
```
$ bm_diff/bm_diff.py -b bm_fullstack_trickle bm_fullstack_unary_ping_pong bm_fullstack_streaming_ping_pong bm_fullstack_streaming_pump  -loops 20 

Benchmark                                                                                     allocs_per_iteration    atm_add_per_iteration
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  ----------------------  -----------------------
BM_PumpStreamClientToServer<UDS>/128M                                                                                 -4%
BM_StreamingPingPong<MinTCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/1                                                         -16%
BM_StreamingPingPong<MinTCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/2                                                         -29%
BM_StreamingPingPong<MinTCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/16M/2                                                          -4%
BM_StreamingPingPong<TCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/1                                                            -4%
BM_StreamingPingPong<TCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/2                                                            -23%
BM_StreamingPingPong<TCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/16M/2                                                             -14%
BM_StreamingPingPongMsgs<MinTCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M                                                       -13%
BM_StreamingPingPongMsgs<MinTCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/16M                                                        -11%
BM_StreamingPingPongMsgs<TCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M                                                          -16%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/2/0     -9%                     -9%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/2/1     -10%                    -9%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<InProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/2M/2/1                               -4%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/2/0  -9%                     -9%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/2/1  -6%                     -5%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/16M/1/1   -4%                     -4%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/2M/2/0    -4%                     -4%
BM_UnaryPingPong<MinInProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/128M                                              -4%
BM_UnaryPingPong<MinInProcessCHTTP2, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/16M/0                          -8%                     -7%
BM_UnaryPingPong<MinTCP, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/128M/128M                                                          -4%
```

Minimal wins and no regressions, this can probably be reviewed now. The failures come from #8996  and #10982
Think this change is worth it? If so I will incorporate it into #11222
